title: Middle East tensions lift oil prices more than 1%
text: Oil prices gained more than 1% to hit their highest levels in two sessions at the start of Monday's trade as Middle East tensions remained elevated, supporting prices.

title: The Saudi Oil Shock: Who Wins, Who Loses
text: On September 14th, drones targeted Saudi Arabia's Abqaiq oil refinery and Khurais oil field, destroying over half of Saudi Arabia's output. Brent crude prices surged 15% from September 13th to 16th.

title: A recession will hit the US within 12 months, market bear David Rosenberg warns

title: A dissenting voice emerges at the Federal Reserve

title: It will be a 'disaster' for Hong Kong if it 'squanders' its financial center status, China investor says

title: Oil gains on Saudi supply disruption, Mideast tensions
text: Oil prices rose to their highest in two sessions on Monday amid concerns about oil supply disruptions from Saudi Arabia and elevated tensions in Middle East.

title: Asian shares gain on better Sino-U.S. trade tone, oil climbs
text: Asian shares started higher on Monday on hopes of an interim Sino-U.S. tariff deal after the two countries described their talks as "productive" and "constructive", while oil gained more than 1% as Middle East tensions remained elevated.

title: U.S. stock futures gain on better trade tone, oil climbs

title: London just overtook New York for fintech investment, research shows
text: London attracted 114 deals worth $2.1 billion in the first eight months of the year, according to new research.

title: Selling On The Fed's Rate Cut
text: Generally, rate drops are positive for the economy, but the market did not seem to be overly excited by the outcome. Wayne Himelsein, one of my top managers, says when it comes to the Fed the old adage buy on the rumor and sell on the news applies.

title: Deutsche Bahn sees big windfall from climate change package
text: Germany's Deutsche Bahn [DBN.UL] expects the government's 50 billion euro climate change package to generate the railway company's biggest growth spurt in its 180-year history, the state-owned firm's boss said on Sunday.

title: Warren Buffett has kept the same investing philosophy for decades, early interview shows
